borrower: AMD Fab 36 Limited Liability Company & Co. KG

core_loan_terms.borrower: AMD Fab 36 Limited Liability Company & Co. KG

amendment_agreements.description: First amendment to the original agreement.
Second amendment to the original agreement.

human_readable_highlights.key_economics: The loan amount is EUR 700,000,000 with a term ending on September 28, 2007. The loan involves multiple high-profile banks as lenders and arrangers.
human_readable_highlights.risks: The loan is secured by a variety of pledges and assignments, including bank accounts, receivables, and material contracts, which could pose risks if the borrower defaults.
human_readable_highlights.unusual_features: The agreement includes multiple amendments and involves complex arrangements with several related companies and multiple types of security and pledges.

definitions.Accounting_Principles: Generally accepted accounting principles in England, including IFRS
definitions.Affiliate: A Subsidiary of the person or a Holding Company of that person or any other Subsidiary of that Holding Company
definitions.Authorisation: An authorisation, consent, approval, resolution, licence, exemption, filing, notarisation or registration
definitions.Availability_Period: From the date of this Agreement to 12 months after the date of this Agreement
definitions.Available_Commitment: Lender's Commitment minus the Base Currency Amount of any outstanding Loans and any Loans due to be made on or before the proposed Utilisation Date
definitions.Base_Currency_Amount: Amount specified in the Utilisation Request delivered by the Borrower for that Loan as adjusted to reflect any repayment, prepayment, consolidation or division of a Loan
definitions.Business_Day: A day (other than a Saturday or Sunday) on which banks are open for general business in London
definitions.Change_of_Control: An event where any person or persons acting in concert, other than a holding company whose shareholders are substantially similar to the pre-existing shareholders of the Borrower, becomes interested in more than 50% of the issued or allotted ordinary share capital of the Borrower or shares carrying more than 50% of the voting rights
definitions.Commitment: £50,000,000 to the extent not cancelled, reduced or transferred
definitions.Confidential_Information: All information relating to the Company, the Group, this Agreement or the Facility of which the Lender becomes aware in its capacity as, or for the purpose of becoming, the Lender or which is received by the Lender in relation to, or for the purpose of becoming a Lender under this Agreement or the Facility from either any member of the Group or any of its advisers
definitions.Confidentiality_Undertaking: A confidentiality undertaking substantially in a recommended form of the LMA or in any other form agreed between the Company and the Lender
definitions.Default: An Event of Default or any event or circumstance specified in Clause 14 which would be an Event of Default with the expiry of a grace period, the giving of notice, the making of any determination under this Agreement or any combination of the foregoing
definitions.Disruption_Event: A material disruption to those payment or communications systems or to those financial markets required for the transactions of this Agreement or any other event resulting in a disruption to the treasury or payments operations of a Party preventing them from performing their payment obligations or from communicating with other Parties in accordance with the terms of this Agreement
definitions.Event_of_Default: Any event or circumstance specified as such in Clause 14
definitions.Facility_Office: The office or offices notified by the Lender to the Borrower in writing as the office or offices through which it will perform its obligations under this Agreement
definitions.Finance_Lease: Any lease or hire purchase contract which would be treated as a balance sheet liability according to the Accounting Principles
definitions.Financial_Indebtedness: Any indebtedness for or in respect of moneys borrowed, debit balances at banks, any acceptance under any acceptance credit or bill discounting facility, any note purchase facility or the issue of bonds, notes, debentures, loan stock or any similar instrument, the amount of any liability in respect of Finance Leases, receivables sold or discounted, and any Treasury Transaction

human_readable_highlights.key_economics: The loan amount is £50,000,000 with a term of 12 months, available as a term loan facility.
human_readable_highlights.risks: Potential disruptions in payment systems or financial markets could impact transactions. A change of control involving more than 50% of the Borrower's share capital could trigger an event of default.
human_readable_highlights.unusual_features: The definition of Confidential Information includes a broad range of data, with specific exclusions for public information or information already known or lawfully obtained by the Lender.

definitions.Acceptable Bank: A bank or financial institution with a rating for its long-term senior unsecured debt obligations of A- or higher by Standard & Poor's or Fitch Ratings Ltd or A3 or higher by Moody's or a comparable rating from an internationally recognised credit rating agency.
definitions.Acquisition: The acquisition of up to 100% of the Target Shares by the Offeror pursuant to a Scheme and/or Offer and/or Squeeze-Out.
definitions.Acquisition Closing Date: The Offer Unconditional Date or the Scheme Effective Date.

Acquisition Costs.a: All fees, costs, commissions, expenses, and taxes incurred in connection with the Acquisition or the Facility.
Acquisition Costs.b: All fees, costs, commissions, expenses, and taxes incurred by or on behalf of the Company and/or the Offeror in connection with the Offer or the Offer Documents.
Acquisition Costs.c: All fees, costs, commissions, expenses, and taxes incurred by or on behalf of the Company and/or the Offeror in connection with the Scheme or the Scheme Documents.

definitions.Acquisition Documents: The Scheme Documents or, as the case may be, the Offer Documents and the Squeeze-Out Documents.
definitions.Additional Business Day: Any day specified as such in the Reference Rate Terms.
definitions.Affiliate: A Subsidiary of the person, a Holding Company of the person, or any other Subsidiary of that Holding Company; in the case of any limited partnership, any entity which owns or controls or is owned or controlled by the first limited partnership or is under common ownership or control with the first limited partnership.

Agent's Spot Rate of Exchange.a: The Agent's spot rate of exchange.
Agent's Spot Rate of Exchange.b: Any other publicly available spot rate of exchange selected by the Agent (acting reasonably) for the purchase of the relevant currency with the Base Currency in the Paris foreign exchange market at or about 11:00 a.m on a particular day.

definitions.Announcement: An Offer Announcement or a Scheme Announcement, including any subsequent announcement and any amendment, replacement, revision, restatement, supplement or modification.

human_readable_highlights.key_economics: The loan amount is £4,300,000,000 provided to CARLSBERG BREWERIES A/S by a consortium of banks including Danske Bank, Skandinaviska Enskilda Banken, and BNP Paribas.
human_readable_highlights.risks: Details on interest rates, repayment terms, and maturity date are not provided in the extracted sections, which could impact financial planning and risk assessment.
human_readable_highlights.unusual_features: The loan supports an acquisition strategy, covering up to 100% of Target Shares, with costs including fees, taxes, and expenses related to the acquisition and facility.

lender: Each lender from time to time party hereto

core_loan_terms.lenders: Each lender from time to time party hereto
core_loan_terms.fees: Various fees including those related to prepayment and administrative tasks.
core_loan_terms.security_or_collateral: Includes ABL Priority Collateral as specified in the Intercreditor Agreement.
core_loan_terms.events_of_default: Standard and specific events including non-payment, breach of agreement, insolvency, and other customary clauses.
core_loan_terms.assignment_and_transferability: Includes provisions for the administrative agent to assign or transfer rights and obligations under the agreement.

dynamic_deal_specific_extraction.loan_purpose: To extend credit to the borrower in the form of Closing Date and Delayed Draw Term Loans.
dynamic_deal_specific_extraction.interest_rates_specifics: Fixed rates applicable to different types of notes and loans under the agreement.
dynamic_deal_specific_extraction.intercreditor_agreement_details: Details the priority of claims between creditors under the ABL Credit Agreement and this term loan.

acknowledgements_and_consent.bail_in: Acknowledgement and consent to the bail-in of EEA Financial Institutions.

human_readable_highlights.key_economics: The total loan amount is $180,000,000 divided into $165,000,000 for Closing Date Term Loans and $15,000,000 for Delayed Draw Term Loans.
human_readable_highlights.risks: Potential risks include default scenarios triggered by non-payment or insolvency, and the impact of senior notes on the financial stability of the borrower.
human_readable_highlights.unusual_features: The agreement includes specific clauses related to the bail-in of EEA Financial Institutions and detailed intercreditor agreement terms.

borrower: AMD Fab 36 Limited Liability Company & Co. KG

amendment_agreements.description: First amendment to the original agreement.
Second amendment to the original agreement.

human_readable_highlights.key_economics: The loan amount is EUR 700,000,000 with a term ending on 28 September 2007.
human_readable_highlights.risks: Complex security arrangements involving multiple entities and accounts, with potential legal complexities in case of default.
human_readable_highlights.unusual_features: Multiple amendments and a wide range of security instruments indicate a highly structured and possibly bespoke financing arrangement.
